topic: A Family Member You Are Proud Of
l1_part2_model_input:
Describe a family member who you are proud of. You should say:
Who this person is
When this happened
What this person did
And explain why you felt proud.
l1_part2_student_q2:
Describe a family member who has achieved something great. You should say:
Who the person is
What the achievement was
How they achieved it
And explain how their achievement influenced you.
l1_part2_student_q3:
Describe a family member you admire for their personality. You should say:
Who this person is
What kind of personality they have
How they treat others
And explain why you admire their character.
l2_part3_questions: What would children do to make their parents proud?
What did you do to make your parents proud when you were young?
What advantages of yours make you proud?
When was the last time that you felt proud of yourself?
How does family pride contribute to the stability of a society?
Do you think the definition of "success" within families has changed between the past and the present?

l1_part2_model_input:
Describe a foreign country where you'd like to work for a short time. You should say:
Where you would like to go
What kind of work you want to do
When you would like to go
And explain why you want to work in that place.
l1_part2_student_q2:
Describe a city you would like to live in for work purposes. You should say:
Which city it is
What industry is popular there
How you know about this place
And explain why this place is good for your career.
l1_part2_student_q3:
Describe a place you visited that you think would be a good place to work. You should say:
Where the place is
When you visited it
What the lifestyle is like there
And explain why you think working there would be enjoyable.
l2_part3_questions: What kind of job is easy to get in a foreign country?
Should young people work abroad?
Do Chinese parents encourage their children to work abroad?
Why do some people not want to work overseas?
What are the benefits of working abroad?
How does the migration of skilled workers (brain drain) affect the economy of the country they leave?

l1_part2_model_input:
Describe your perfect job. You should say:
What it is
Where you heard about it
What you need to learn to get the job
And explain why you think it is your perfect job.
l1_part2_student_q2:
Describe a job you would like to have in the future. You should say:
What the job is
What qualifications are required
Whether it is a popular job
And explain why this job appeals to you.
l1_part2_student_q3:
Describe a well-paid job that you would be good at. You should say:
What the job is
What skills you have that match this job
How you would find this job
And explain why you think you would succeed in this role.
l2_part3_questions: What jobs do children want to do when they grow up?
What should people consider when choosing jobs?
Is salary the main reason people choose a certain job?
What kind of jobs are well-paid?
Do people's ideal jobs change as they grow up?
To what extent does technology (such as AI) threaten traditional job roles in modern society?

l1_part2_model_input:
Describe a movie you watched recently that you felt disappointed about. You should say:
What it was
Why you decided to watch it
When you watched it
And explain why you felt disappointed about it.
l1_part2_student_q2:
Describe a film that did not meet your expectations. You should say:
What the film was called
What you expected to see
What actually happened in the film
And explain why it failed to meet your expectations.
l1_part2_student_q3:
Describe a time you regretted watching a specific movie or show. You should say:
Where you watched it
Who you watched it with
Why you chose it
And explain what made the experience negative.
l2_part3_questions: Do you believe movie reviews?
What are the different types of films in your country?
Are historical films popular in your country? Why?
Do you think films with famous actors or actresses are more likely to become successful?
Why are Japanese animated films so popular?
Should directors pay a lot of money to famous actors?

l1_part2_model_input:
Describe a person who encouraged you to protect nature. You should say:
Who this person is
How you knew this person
What he/she said or did to encourage you
And explain how you felt about it.
l1_part2_student_q2:
Describe a person who is very interested in the environment. You should say:
Who they are
What they do to help the environment
How they influence others
And explain what you have learned from them.
l1_part2_student_q3:
Describe an environmental activist or leader you admire. You should say:
Who this person is
What cause they fight for
How they spread their message
And explain why you respect their efforts.
l2_part3_questions: How do people protect the environment?
Do you think it's important to protect wild animals/nature?
What are the main environmental problems in your country?
Do you think we should use more renewable energy? Why?
Should schools teach students about environmental protection?
[New] How effective is international cooperation in solving global environmental crises?

l1_part2_model_input:
Describe a place with a lot of trees that you would like to visit (e.g., a forest, oasis). You should say:
Where it is
How you knew this place
What it is like
And explain why you would like to visit it.
l1_part2_student_q2:
Describe a park or garden in your city that you enjoy visiting. You should say:
Where it is located
How often you go there
What you do there
And explain why you find this place relaxing.
l1_part2_student_q3:
Describe a natural environment (such as a forest or mountain) that impressed you. You should say:
Where this place is
When you went there
Who you went with
And explain why this place was memorable.
l2_part3_questions: Why do people like visiting places with trees or forests?
Are natural views better than city views?
Do all people need some nature?
Are people hard-wired to protect the environment?
How does rapid urbanization impact the mental health of city dwellers?
Should governments prioritize economic development over the preservation of natural green spaces?

l1_part2_model_input:
Describe an application (app) you usually use on your phone or computer. You should say:
What it is
When you use it
Why you use it often
And explain how you feel about it.
l1_part2_student_q2:
Describe a mobile app that has made your daily life easier. You should say:
What the app is
How it functions
What specific problem it solves for you
And explain why you would recommend it to others.
l1_part2_student_q3:
Describe an app you use for learning or self-improvement. You should say:
What the app teaches
How often you use it
How effective it is
And explain why you prefer using an app over traditional methods.
l2_part3_questions: What is the difference between how young and old people use apps?
Why do some people dislike using apps?
What is the most popular app in your country?
Are people becoming too dependent on mobile apps?
To what extent do mobile applications compromise user privacy and data security?
Will digital tools eventually replace traditional face-to-face services entirely?

l1_part2_model_input:
Describe a time when you gave advice to others. You should say:
When it was
To whom you gave the advice
What the advice was

l1_part2_student_q2:
Describe a time you received useful advice from someone. You should say:
Who gave you the advice
What the situation was
How you applied the advice
And explain how this advice helped you.
l1_part2_student_q3:
Describe a situation where you had to make a difficult decision. You should say:
What the decision was
Who you consulted for help
What the outcome was
And explain how you felt after making the decision.
l2_part3_questions: Should people prepare before giving advice?
Is it good to ask for advice from strangers online?
What are the personalities of people whose job is to give advice to others?
What are the problems if you ask too many people for advice?
Is the advice given by older generations still relevant to the problems young people face today?
To what extent does professional counseling differ from advice given by friends or family?

l1_part2_model_input:
Describe a child who enjoys drawing/painting. You should say:
How you know this child
How often he/she draws
What he/she likes to draw or paint

Describe a creative child you know. You should say:
Who the child is
What creative activity they do (e.g., crafts, building)
How they show their creativity

l1_part2_student_q3:
Describe a young person who has a natural talent. You should say:
Who they are
What their talent is (music, art, sports, etc.)
How you discovered their talent
And explain what you think the future holds for them.
l2_part3_questions: Why do people choose to visit galleries and museums in person instead of viewing art online?
Should galleries and museums be free of charge to the public?
Why do some people find life inspiration from visiting these places?
Why do most children draw more often than adults do?
Is art education in schools as important as science or mathematics?
How does engaging in artistic activities contribute to the cognitive development of a society?

l1_part2_model_input:
Describe an interesting building you'd like to visit. You should say:
Where it is
How you knew about it
What you know about it
And explain how you will feel if you go there.
l1_part2_student_q2:
Describe a historical building in your country. You should say:
Where it is located
When it was built
What it is used for today
And explain why it is important to your country's heritage.
l1_part2_student_q3:
Describe a modern building that impressed you. You should say:
Where it is
What it looks like
What function it serves
And explain why you admire its architecture.
l2_part3_questions: Should all museums and historical buildings sell tickets?
Which kind of building do people prefer, villas or apartments?
Why do people prefer to live in new houses?
Which do people prefer, modern buildings or traditional buildings?
How does the architecture of a city influence the cultural identity of its residents?
Is it necessary to preserve old buildings even if they impede modern urban development?

l1_part2_model_input:
Describe a technology product you would like to own. You should say:
What it is
How much it costs
What you will use it for
And explain why you would like to own it.
l1_part2_student_q2:
Describe a piece of modern technology that saves you time. You should say:
What the device is
How often you use it
How it works
And explain why it is efficient.
l1_part2_student_q3:
Describe an invention that has changed the world significantly. You should say:
What the invention is
When it was created
How it affects our daily lives
And explain whether you think the change is positive or negative.
l2_part3_questions: What tech products are your friends using these days?
Why do people love using tech products?
What are the differences between chatting online and chatting face-to-face?
Has technology widened the economic gap between the rich and the poor?
Do you think people are losing their ability to communicate effectively due to screens?
To what extent should governments regulate the development of Artificial Intelligence?

l1_part2_model_input:
Describe an occasion when you lost your way. You should say:
Where you were
What happened
How you felt
And explain how you found your way.
l1_part2_student_q2:
Describe a time you arrived late for an important event. You should say:
What the event was
Why you were late
What the consequences were
And explain how you felt about the situation.
l1_part2_student_q3:
Describe a time you helped someone who was lost. You should say:
Where this happened
Who the person was
How you helped them
And explain how you felt after helping them.
l2_part3_questions: Why do some people get lost more easily than others?
Do you think it is important to do some preparation before you travel to new places?
How can people find their way when they are lost?
Is a paper map still necessary?
Has the reliance on GPS technology reduced our natural ability to navigate?
How does getting "lost" (metaphorically) in a new culture help a person grow?

l1_part2_model_input:
Describe a famous person you would like to meet. You should say:
Who he/she is
How you know about him/her
How/where you would like to meet him/her

l1_part2_student_q2:
Describe a famous sportsperson you admire. You should say:
Who this person is
What sport they play
What achievements they have made
And explain why you admire them more than other athletes.
l1_part2_student_q3:
Describe a famous person from your country who is known internationally. You should say:
Who they are
What they are famous for (e.g., politics, arts, science)
How they represent your country
And explain if you are proud of them.
l2_part3_questions: What are the advantages and disadvantages of being a famous child?
What can today's children do to become famous?
Do people become famous because of their talent?
Should students have physical education and do sports at school?
To what extent do celebrities sacrifice their privacy for their career?
Do famous people have a moral responsibility to be good role models for society?

l1_part2_model_input:
Describe a shopping mall you often visit. You should say:
Where it is
Who you usually go with
What you do there
And explain why you like going to this mall so often.
l1_part2_student_q2:
Describe a traditional street market you enjoy visiting. You should say:
Where it is located
What kinds of things they sell
How the atmosphere differs from a mall
And explain why you like shopping there.
l1_part2_student_q3:
Describe a shop that you recently recommended to a friend. You should say:
What the shop sells
Where it is
Why you recommended it
And explain what makes this shop special.
l2_part3_questions: Some people believe building shopping malls isn't a good thing, what do you think?
Why do people enjoy going to malls?
How did people pay in the past, and how do they pay now?
What are the downsides of mobile payments?
Has the rise of e-commerce (online shopping) caused the death of local small businesses?

l1_part2_model_input:
Describe a book you read that you found useful. You should say:
What it is
When you read it
Why you think it is useful
And explain how you felt about it.
l1_part2_student_q2:
Describe a story you read or heard recently. You should say:
What the story was about
Where you read or heard it
Who the main characters were
And explain why this story stayed in your memory.
l1_part2_student_q3:
Describe a traditional story from your country. You should say:
What the story is
When you first heard it

l2_part3_questions: What should the government do to make libraries better?

Has the internet reduced the attention span required to read long novels?
Is storytelling an essential part of preserving a culture's history?

l1_part2_model_input:
Describe an occasion when many people laughed together. You should say:
When it happened
Where it happened
Who you were with

l1_part2_student_q2:
Describe a time you saw someone show their feelings very openly. You should say:
Who this person was
What happened to make them emotional
How they expressed their feelings (laughing, crying, etc.)
And explain how you felt witnessing this.
l1_part2_student_q3:
Describe a comedy movie or live performance that made you laugh. You should say:
What it was

l2_part3_questions: Why do people laugh in their daily lives?

Should we express our emotions immediately or hide them?

Is humor an essential tool for effective leadership in the workplace?
How does cultural background influence what people find funny?

l1_part2_model_input:
Describe a friend you have known for a long time. You should say:
Where you met this friend
When you met this friend

Describe a friend who has played an important role in your life. You should say:
Who they are

What you admire about them

Describe a friend who is talented at music or singing. You should say:

l2_part3_questions: What is the difference between friendships at work and those outside of work?

Describe a house or apartment you would like to live in. You should say:

How big it would be

l1_part2_student_q3:

l2_part3_questions: Why is it difficult for some people to relax?

What the object is
How long your family has had it

l1_part2_student_q3:
Describe a gift you received that you treasure. You should say:
What the gift is
Who gave it to you

l2_part3_questions: Why do some grown-ups hate to throw out old things?

Is the culture of consumerism (buying things for pleasure) sustainable for the planet?
Does the "planned obsolescence" of products (products designed to break) harm society?
